list_definition.definition: one of the hooked nails of an animal or bird

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The cat sharpened its claws on the tree trunk.

list_definition.definition: the foot of an animal or bird with hooked nails

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The owl held the mouse in its claw.

list_definition.definition: (the pointed end of) the leg of a crab etc.
to scratch or tear (at something) with claws or nails

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The two cats clawed at each other.

list_ex_of_english: Previously, if stocks ran too low, there was the danger of tax being clawed back.
The clawing back of £1,000 million from taxpayers is bound to increase unemployment substantially.
The new face offered every prospect of clawing back earlier losses.
Pads almost as long as claws.
They were scratching on the wire until they had pulled their claws out of their front paws trying to escape.
Measurement of the thickness of the corium and subcutaneous tissue of the hind claws of dairy cattle by ultrasound.
He hopes that by the time he is ready to demonstrate it to the military the lobster will have two claws which it can use as bump sensors.
At the same time housing benefit has been clawed back substantially.
